page.title: 15RECREATION, GLIDING
page.content: RECREATION. AIRFIELD. GLIDING. A major tourist attraction of this area is The Wolds Gliding Club. It uses one of the run-ways running S/SE to N/NW. There are various gliders some belonging to the club and some private but housed at the club. There is Caravan accommodattion for members & guests. Apart from the lessons on offer there is also a package holiday offer which includes accommodation & lessons. Two types of lift-off are used there is a light aircraft for towing and there is also a converted bus for winching. Permission is at present being sought to extend the area of caravans, so that the membership can increase. The Obelisk erected in 1985 in memory of R.A.F.,Squadrons 405 & 102 is to be found close by the Gliding Club Head-quarters.
